**Time Management Workshop**: Organize a workshop focusing on effective time management techniques. Invite experts who can share their experiences on how to plan your day better, prioritize tasks, avoid procrastination, and manage stress. This can help you learn strategies to tackle assignments more efficiently in the future.

**Digital Detox Challenge**: Engage in a digital detox for a week. Remove all distractions such as social media, emails, and unnecessary apps from your devices. This can help improve focus, reduce stress, and give you more time to dedicate to your work and personal development.

**Mindfulness and Meditation Sessions**: Participate in mindfulness or meditation sessions which can enhance your mental clarity, reduce anxiety, and improve overall productivity. Regular practice can make you more present and efficient when working on assignments.

**Create a Productivity Planner**: Design a personalized productivity planner that includes sections for task listing, deadlines, breaks, and reflection. Use tools like calendars, to-do lists, and habit trackers to keep yourself accountable and motivated. Regularly updating this planner will help you stay organized and focused.

**Leverage Technology for Better Time Management**: Invest in productivity tools and apps designed to streamline your workflow. For example, use project management software to track progress, set reminders, and collaborate with others. Tools like Trello, Asana, or Todoist can significantly enhance your efficiency and reduce the chances of missing deadlines.
